item.title: Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012
Welfare Integrity and Data Improvement Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: WIN for Children and Families Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

summary.text:
Welfare Integrity Now for Children and Families Act of 2011 or WIN for Children and Families Act - Amends part A (Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) (TANF) of title IV of the Social Security Act to require a state to which a state family assistance grant is made to maintain policies and practices necessary to prevent the use of state TANF assistance in any transaction in a liquor store, casino or gambling establishment, or strip club.

Establishes administrative penalties for states which have not reported on their implementation of or enforced such policies and practices.

bill.title: WIN for Children and Families Act

item.title: WIN for Children and Families Act
Welfare Integrity Now for Children and Families Act of 2011
WIN for Children and Families Act

A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to require States to implement policies to prevent assistance under the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program from being used in strip clubs, casinos, and liquor stores.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
